description.narrative: The project addresses desertification in Central and Northern Somalia. The development objective of the project is to enhance sustainable development of the environment and well-being of local people. In particular the aim is to stop desertification at thr ee project areas. Immediate objectives include the following: the number and variety of the trees increase, environmental awareness increases, soil condition improves, traditional grass becomes available, and the capacity and cooperation between local part ners improves. These objectives are to be reached through a long-term project (3 times 3 years) which (2013-2015) includes training and environmental awareness raising, construction of three environmental protection centers (including demonstration farms a nd tree nurseries), seedling growing and planting, land rehabilitation, introducing and promotingalternative energy sources,and capacity building of the local partners. This is a joint project implemented in partnership with Finnish Somalia Network three o f its member organizations (Puntland Community PC, Sool Sanaag and Hawd Development Association SSHDA, and Somali Social Development Association SSDA) and their respective partner organizations in North and Central Somalia (Homboboro Relief and Rehabilitat ion Organization HRRO, Nomadic Development Organization NDO, and Tanaad Relief and Development Organization TARDO). The project creates an innovative cooperative model which enforces the civil society in Somalia and creates new networks.The final beneficia ries of the project are in total 1600 households (400 households in Buhodle area 600 in Gaalkaacyo area 600 in Adado area) whose environment and opportunities to livelihood will improve through tree planting and land rehabilitation. Each household will par ticipate in planting demonstrations and will be given tree seedlings. This is a continuation project for the project which started in January 2012 by the funding provided by the Ministry for Foreign Affairs.
